page.title: 18HEALTH
page.content: The Group Surgery in Alresford is the centre for medical care. Senior citizens,bed-ridden patients and the disabled are visited in their homes by doctors,district nurse ,chiropodists. Villagers must visit dentists and opticians and the nearest hospital is in Winchester. There is a system of "review" for patients which may continue for years, either annually or more frequently. Transport is provided by ambulance or hospital car service. All immediate health care is free of charge but there are charges for dental,optical and prescriptions. Some villagers choose to pay for private health care, usually via health insurance schemes.
